verses.verse: ((The people of God from their bottomless miseries do cry unto God, and are heard.3 They confess their sins, and flee unto Godâ€™s mercies.) ) Out of the deep places have I called unto thee, O Lord.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears attend to the voice of my prayers.
If thou, O Lord, straightly markest iniquities, O Lord, (He declareth that we cannot be just before God but by forgiveness of sins.) who shall stand?
But mercy is with thee, that thou (Because of nature thou art merciful: therefore the faithful reverence thee.) mayest be feared.
I have waited on the Lord: my soul hath waited, and I have trusted in his word.
My soul waiteth on the Lord more than the morning watch watcheth for the morning.

Let Israel wait on the Lord: for with the Lord is (He showeth to whom the mercy of God doth appertain: to Israel, that is, to the Church and not to the reprobate.) mercy, and with him is great redemption.
And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
